body.p: State of Kentucky Breathitt County Sct

The affiant A. B. Patrick maketh oath and saith that not long since in a conversation with John Gambill the prosocutor in the Case of The Commonwealth against Daniel Akeman who was convicted in the Perry Circuit court to the penetentiary for stealing money from said Gambill

Said Gambill acknowledged to affiiant A B Patrick that he did not believe that Akeman Gambill hadd become satisfied that Akeman never got one cent of the money that he hade lost and that woul be glad if Akeman was pardoned and that he was willing to do any thing that was honorable to get Akeman pardoned
Sept 3rd 1861

State of Kentucky
Breathitt County } Sct

Sworn to before me by A B Patrick this 3rd day of Sept 1861
J, P, B, C
John Cardwell J P B C
Petition to the Governor & accompying papers asking that Danl Akeman convict in the state prison shall be pardoned
File in Akeman case -- B. M
